Author: busy_beaver
Content: Someone mentioned below that it's working on Reddit. I just looked at their feed, and it looks like they are indeed putting the comments link inside "description" rather than "comments".

Author: busy_beaver
Content:
Feedvalidator finds a couple of problems, but I'm not sure that they're related.

http://feedvalidator.org/check.cgi?url=http%3A%2F%2Fnews.ycombinator.com%2Frss

Maybe try generating an Atom feed? Atom seems to be much better defined than any of the myriad competing RSS implementations.

Or maybe toss a hyperlink into the description tag rather than the comments tag ... from what I see in the RSS 2.0 spec, comments is a more of a "should" rather than a "must". The spec itself refers to it as an optional element, and Winer (I think) says in a note that implementers "should" support it. Clearly some of them don't. :-)

Author: mojuba
Content: You probably took that number from Wikipedia, where Russia (100m) and Turkey (80m) and many other unrelated countries count as Europe too. The exact number for today's EU is 486m.

Author: acgourley
Content:
Of course you're only getting what you pay for at other hosts if you use exactly your allotment.

Consider the websites I'm working on now, I need some advanced features so I have a medium sized package with way too much disk and bandwidth.
